channel.title: Biz & IT on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in Biz & IT on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: Exhausted man defeats AI model in world coding championship
item.description: “Humanity has prevailed (for now!),” writes winner after 10-hour coding marathon against OpenAI.

item.title: Phishers have found a way to downgrade—not bypass—FIDO MFA
item.description: Contrary to recent reports, phishing sleight-of-hand doesn’t defeat FIDO.

item.title: GitHub abused to distribute payloads on behalf of malware-as-a-service
item.description: The repository offered the MaaS a distribution channel not blocked in many networks.

item.title: ChatGPT’s new AI agent can browse the web and create PowerPoint slideshows
item.description: New “agentic” AI feature combines web browsing with task-execution abilities.

item.title: Google hides secret message in name list of 3,295 AI researchers
item.description: Gemini 2.5 paper hides Easter egg in massive author list—but why so many contributors?

item.title: Why it takes 3,295 people to write one Google AI paper
item.description: Gemini 2.5 paper hides Easter egg in massive author list—but why so many contributors?

item.title: More VMware cloud partners axed as Broadcom launches new invite-only program
item.description: Smaller businesses most likely to be affected as white-label cloud program is also ending.

item.title: Google finds custom backdoor being installed on SonicWall network devices
item.description: Overstep backdoor nukes key log entries, making detection hard.

item.title: Hackers exploit a blind spot by hiding malware inside DNS records
item.description: Technique transforms the Internet DNS into an unconventional file storage system.

item.title: Chinese firms rush for Nvidia chips as US prepares to lift ban
item.description: H20 chips, designed to skirt export bans, are back after Trump meets with CEO.

item.title: Nvidia chips become the first GPUs to fall to Rowhammer bit-flip attacks
item.description: GPUhammer is the first to flip bits in onboard GPU memory. It likely won’t be the last.

item.title: New Grok AI model surprises experts by checking Elon Musk’s views before answering
item.description: Grok 4’s “reasoning” shows cases where the chatbot consults Musk posts to answer divisive questions.

item.title: AI therapy bots fuel delusions and give dangerous advice, Stanford study finds
item.description: Popular chatbots serve as poor replacements for human therapists, but study authors call for nuance.

item.title: Pro basketball player and 4 youths arrested in connection to ransomware crimes
item.description: Suspects were allegedly involved in a string of ransomware breaches.
